prompts.title: Business Model Canvas Generator
prompts.description: Creates a complete Business Model Canvas with strategic analysis
prompts.prompt:
You are a startup strategist who has helped launch 100+ successful businesses. Create a comprehensive Business Model Canvas for my business idea.

**Business Idea:**
- Name: [BUSINESS NAME]
- One-Line Description: [WHAT IT DOES]
- Target Market: [WHO IT'S FOR]
- Problem Solved: [PAIN POINT]
- Stage: [IDEA/MVP/GROWTH]

**Generate a complete Business Model Canvas:**

## üéØ Business Model Canvas: [NAME]

### 1. üë• Customer Segments
- Primary Segment: [Who pays?]
- Secondary Segment: [Other users?]
- Persona: [Detailed ideal customer]
- Market Size: [TAM/SAM/SOM estimates]

### 2. üíé Value Propositions
- Primary Value: [Main benefit]
- Unique Differentiator: [Why you vs competitors]
- Pain Relievers: [Problems solved]
- Gain Creators: [Benefits delivered]

### 3. üì£ Channels
- Awareness: [How they find you]
- Evaluation: [How they decide]
- Purchase: [How they buy]
- Delivery: [How they receive value]
- After-Sales: [Ongoing support]

### 4. üíï Customer Relationships
- Acquisition Strategy: [Get customers]
- Retention Strategy: [Keep customers]
- Growth Strategy: [Expand revenue per customer]

### 5. üí∞ Revenue Streams
- Primary Revenue: [Main income source]
- Secondary Revenue: [Additional income]
- Pricing Model: [How you charge]
- Pricing Strategy: [Price points]

### 6. üîë Key Resources
- Physical: [Tangible assets]
- Intellectual: [IP, patents, data]
- Human: [Key roles needed]
- Financial: [Capital requirements]

### 7. üé¨ Key Activities
- Production: [Creating value]
- Problem-Solving: [Serving customers]
- Platform/Network: [If applicable]

### 8. ü§ù Key Partnerships
- Strategic Alliances: [Non-competitors]
- Suppliers: [Key vendors]
- Joint Ventures: [Shared initiatives]

### 9. üí∏ Cost Structure
- Fixed Costs: [Constant expenses]
- Variable Costs: [Scale with revenue]
- Economies of Scale: [Cost advantages]

### üìä Financial Snapshot
- Break-even: [Units/customers needed]
- Unit Economics: [CAC, LTV, margins]

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Key Risks & Mitigations
[Top 3 risks and how to address them]
prompts.example_output:
## üéØ Business Model Canvas: FitMeal AI

*AI-powered meal planning app for busy professionals*

---

### 1. üë• Customer Segments

**Primary Segment:** Busy professionals (25-45) who want to eat healthy but lack time to plan meals

**Secondary Segment:** Fitness enthusiasts tracking macros

**Ideal Customer Persona:**
> "Sarah, 32, marketing manager. Works 50+ hours/week. Wants to lose 15 lbs but orders DoorDash 4x/week because she's too tired to plan meals. Has tried meal prep but gave up after 2 weeks. Willing to pay for convenience."

**Market Size:**
- TAM: $12B (global meal planning market)
- SAM: $2B (US health-conscious professionals)
- SOM: $50M (early adopters, first 3 years)

---

### 2. üíé Value Propositions

**Primary Value:** "Eat healthy without thinking about it"

**Unique Differentiator:** AI learns your preferences, dietary restrictions, and schedule to create personalized weekly meal plans in 30 seconds

**Pain Relievers:**
- ‚ùå No more "what's for dinner?" decision fatigue
- ‚ùå No more food waste from unused groceries
- ‚ùå No more falling off diet due to lack of planning

**Gain Creators:**
- ‚úÖ Save 5+ hours/week on meal planning
- ‚úÖ Auto-generated grocery lists
- ‚úÖ Recipes adjusted to what's in your fridge
- ‚úÖ Nutritional goals tracked automatically

---

### 3. üì£ Channels

| Stage | Channel | Tactics |
|-------|---------|--------|
| **Awareness** | Social Media | TikTok meal prep content, Instagram reels |
| **Awareness** | Content | SEO blog: "healthy meals for busy people" |
| **Evaluation** | Free Trial | 7-day free meal plan |
| **Purchase** | App Store | iOS/Android with in-app subscription |
| **Delivery** | Mobile App | Push notifications, weekly plan delivery |
| **After-Sales** | Email | Weekly tips, recipe highlights, re-engagement |

---

### 4. üíï Customer Relationships

**Acquisition Strategy:**
- Freemium model (basic plans free, premium features paid)
- Referral program ($5 credit for both parties)
- Influencer partnerships (fitness/lifestyle)

**Retention Strategy:**
- Personalization improves over time (switching cost)
- Weekly "wins" emails showing calories saved, money saved
- Community challenges and streaks

**Growth Strategy:**
- Family plan upsell
- Grocery delivery integration (affiliate revenue)
- Premium "chef-curated" meal plans

---

### 5. üí∞ Revenue Streams

**Primary Revenue:** Subscriptions (80%)
- Basic: Free (limited recipes, ads)
- Premium: $9.99/month (unlimited, no ads, advanced features)
- Family: $14.99/month (up to 5 profiles)

**Secondary Revenue:** (20%)
- Grocery delivery affiliate commissions (Instacart, Amazon Fresh)
- Sponsored recipes from food brands
- Anonymized data insights to CPG companies

**Pricing Strategy:** 
- Anchored against competitors ($15-20/month)
- Annual discount: $79.99/year (33% off)
- Target: 5% free-to-paid conversion

---

### 6. üîë Key Resources

**Intellectual:**
- Proprietary AI recommendation algorithm
- Recipe database (10,000+ recipes)
- User preference data

**Human:**
- 2 ML engineers
- 1 nutritionist/content creator
- 1 mobile developer
- 1 growth marketer

**Financial:**
- $500K seed funding needed
- 18-month runway target

---

### 7. üé¨ Key Activities

**Production:**
- AI model training and improvement
- Recipe curation and testing
- App development and maintenance

**Problem-Solving:**
- Customer support (chatbot + human)
- Dietary restriction handling
- Preference learning optimization

**Platform:**
- User data collection and analysis
- Third-party integrations (grocery, fitness apps)

---

### 8. ü§ù Key Partnerships

**Strategic Alliances:**
- Fitness apps (MyFitnessPal, Strava) - data sync
- Corporate wellness programs - B2B channel
- Health insurance companies - subsidized subscriptions

**Suppliers:**
- Recipe content creators
- Nutritional database providers (USDA, Nutritionix)
- Cloud infrastructure (AWS)

**Affiliate Partners:**
- Instacart, Amazon Fresh, Walmart Grocery
- Kitchen equipment brands
- Meal kit companies (for users who want done-for-you)

---

### 9. üí∏ Cost Structure

**Fixed Costs:** (~$40K/month)
- Team salaries: $30K
- Cloud infrastructure: $5K
- Tools & software: $2K
- Office/remote stipends: $3K

**Variable Costs:**
- Customer acquisition: $15 CAC target
- Payment processing: 3% of revenue
- Customer support: $0.50/user/month

**Economies of Scale:**
- AI improves with more data (no additional cost)
- Recipe database is one-time investment
- Support costs decrease with better AI

---

### üìä Financial Snapshot

**Unit Economics:**
- CAC: $15
- LTV: $72 (avg 8 months √ó $9/month after churn)
- LTV:CAC Ratio: 4.8:1 ‚úÖ
- Gross Margin: 85%

**Break-Even Analysis:**
- Monthly costs: $40,000
- Revenue per premium user: $9/month
- Break-even: 4,445 paying users
- With 5% conversion: Need 89,000 free users

**18-Month Projection:**
- Month 6: 1,000 paying users ($9K MRR)
- Month 12: 5,000 paying users ($45K MRR)
- Month 18: 15,000 paying users ($135K MRR)

---

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Key Risks & Mitigations

| Risk | Probability | Impact | Mitigation |
|------|-------------|--------|------------|
| **Big player enters market** (Google, Apple) | Medium | High | Build community moat, niche focus on specific diets |
| **Low conversion rate** (<3%) | Medium | High | A/B test onboarding, improve free tier value |
| **AI recommendations poor quality** | Low | High | Human review layer, feedback loops, nutritionist oversight |

---

### üöÄ Next Steps

1. **Validate:** Survey 100 target users on willingness to pay
2. **MVP:** Build basic meal plan generator (4 weeks)
3. **Test:** Launch to 500 beta users, measure engagement
4. **Iterate:** Improve based on feedback before scaling

prompts.title: Competitor Analysis Deep Dive
prompts.description: Performs comprehensive competitive analysis with strategic insights
prompts.prompt:
You are a competitive intelligence analyst who has advised Fortune 500 companies on market strategy. Conduct a deep competitive analysis.

**My Business:**
- Company/Product: [YOUR BUSINESS]
- Industry: [INDUSTRY]
- Target Market: [WHO YOU SERVE]
- Key Differentiator: [YOUR UNIQUE VALUE]

**Competitors to Analyze:**
1. [COMPETITOR 1]
2. [COMPETITOR 2]
3. [COMPETITOR 3]

**Generate comprehensive analysis:**

## üéØ Competitive Landscape: [INDUSTRY]

### üìä Market Overview
- Market Size: [Estimate]
- Growth Rate: [Trend]
- Key Trends: [3-5 trends]

### üè¢ Competitor Profiles

#### [Competitor 1]
- **Overview:** [What they do]
- **Founded/Size:** [Year, employees, funding]
- **Target Market:** [Who they serve]
- **Pricing:** [Model and price points]
- **Strengths:** [What they do well]
- **Weaknesses:** [Where they fall short]
- **Recent Moves:** [Latest news/features]

[Repeat for each competitor]

### üìà Feature Comparison Matrix

| Feature | You | Comp 1 | Comp 2 | Comp 3 |
|---------|-----|--------|--------|--------|
| [Feature 1] | | | | |

### üí∞ Pricing Comparison
[Table comparing pricing tiers]

### üéØ Positioning Map
[2x2 matrix positioning]

### üí™ Your Competitive Advantages
[Where you can win]

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Competitive Threats
[Where you're vulnerable]

### üöÄ Strategic Recommendations
[How to compete and win]
prompts.example_output:
## üéØ Competitive Landscape: Project Management Software

### üìä Market Overview

- **Market Size:** $6.68B (2023), projected $15.08B by 2030
- **Growth Rate:** 13.7% CAGR
- **Key Trends:**
  1. AI-powered automation and suggestions
  2. Remote-first collaboration features
  3. Integration ecosystem expansion
  4. Vertical-specific solutions emerging
  5. Consolidation (all-in-one vs. best-of-breed)

---

### üè¢ Competitor Profiles

#### 1. Asana

**Overview:** Work management platform for teams to organize, track, and manage work

**Founded/Size:** 2008 | 1,500+ employees | Public (NYSE: ASAN) | $1.5B+ raised

**Target Market:** Mid-market to Enterprise teams (50-5000 employees), especially marketing and product teams

**Pricing:**
- Basic: Free (up to 15 users)
- Premium: $10.99/user/month
- Business: $24.99/user/month
- Enterprise: Custom

**Strengths:**
- ‚úÖ Beautiful, intuitive UI
- ‚úÖ Strong workflow automation
- ‚úÖ Excellent timeline/Gantt views
- ‚úÖ 200+ integrations
- ‚úÖ Strong brand recognition

**Weaknesses:**
- ‚ùå Expensive at scale
- ‚ùå Can be overwhelming for simple use cases
- ‚ùå Limited time tracking (requires integration)
- ‚ùå Reporting requires Business tier

**Recent Moves:**
- Launched AI "Intelligence" features (Oct 2023)
- Acquired Vimcal for scheduling
- Focusing on enterprise sales

---

#### 2. Monday.com

**Overview:** Work OS that powers teams to run projects and workflows

**Founded/Size:** 2012 | 1,800+ employees | Public (NASDAQ: MNDY) | $574M raised

**Target Market:** SMB to Mid-market, non-technical teams, especially sales and marketing

**Pricing:**
- Individual: Free (up to 2 users)
- Basic: $8/user/month
- Standard: $10/user/month
- Pro: $16/user/month
- Enterprise: Custom

**Strengths:**
- ‚úÖ Highly customizable/flexible
- ‚úÖ Visual, colorful interface
- ‚úÖ Strong marketing presence
- ‚úÖ Good for non-technical users
- ‚úÖ Expanding into CRM, Dev, etc.

**Weaknesses:**
- ‚ùå Can become expensive quickly
- ‚ùå Performance issues with large boards
- ‚ùå Steep learning curve for advanced features
- ‚ùå Limited free tier

**Recent Moves:**
- Launched Monday AI assistant
- Expanded into CRM and Dev products
- Heavy investment in brand advertising

---

#### 3. ClickUp

**Overview:** All-in-one productivity platform replacing multiple tools

**Founded/Size:** 2017 | 1,000+ employees | Private | $537M raised (Series C)

**Target Market:** Startups to Mid-market, teams wanting to consolidate tools

**Pricing:**
- Free Forever: Unlimited users, limited features
- Unlimited: $7/user/month
- Business: $12/user/month
- Enterprise: Custom

**Strengths:**
- ‚úÖ Most features for the price
- ‚úÖ Generous free tier
- ‚úÖ Docs, whiteboards, goals built-in
- ‚úÖ Highly customizable views
- ‚úÖ Aggressive feature development

**Weaknesses:**
- ‚ùå Can be buggy/slow
- ‚ùå Overwhelming number of features
- ‚ùå Mobile app needs improvement
- ‚ùå Customer support complaints

**Recent Moves:**
- Launched ClickUp AI
- Major UI overhaul (ClickUp 3.0)
- Expanding enterprise sales team

---

### üìà Feature Comparison Matrix

| Feature | TaskFlow (You) | Asana | Monday | ClickUp |
|---------|---------------|-------|--------|--------|
| **Task Management** | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ |
| **Kanban Boards** | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ |
| **Gantt/Timeline** | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ |
| **Time Tracking** | ‚úÖ Built-in | ‚ùå Integration | ‚úÖ Add-on | ‚úÖ Built-in |
| **Native Docs** | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ |
| **AI Features** | ‚úÖ Advanced | ‚úÖ Basic | ‚úÖ Basic | ‚úÖ Basic |
| **Free Tier** | ‚úÖ Generous | ‚ö†Ô∏è Limited | ‚ö†Ô∏è Very Limited | ‚úÖ Generous |
| **Mobile App** | ‚úÖ Excellent | ‚úÖ Good | ‚úÖ Good | ‚ö†Ô∏è Needs work |
| **API/Integrations** | ‚ö†Ô∏è Growing | ‚úÖ 200+ | ‚úÖ 200+ | ‚úÖ 100+ |
| **Enterprise Security** | ‚ö†Ô∏è Roadmap | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ |

---

### üí∞ Pricing Comparison (Per User/Month, Billed Annually)

| Tier | TaskFlow | Asana | Monday | ClickUp |
|------|----------|-------|--------|--------|
| **Free** | 10 users | 15 users | 2 users | Unlimited |
| **Starter** | $5 | $10.99 | $8 | $7 |
| **Pro** | $12 | $24.99 | $16 | $12 |
| **Enterprise** | Custom | Custom | Custom | Custom |

**Your Pricing Advantage:** 50% cheaper than Asana at Pro tier, comparable to ClickUp with better UX.

---

### üéØ Positioning Map

```
                    ENTERPRISE-FOCUSED
                          |
                    Asana ‚óè
                          |
    SIMPLE ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ COMPLEX
                          |
              TaskFlow ‚óè  |  ‚óè ClickUp
                    Monday ‚óè
                          |
                    SMB-FOCUSED
```

**Your Position:** Simple enough for SMBs, powerful enough for growing teams. The "Goldilocks" option.

---

### üí™ Your Competitive Advantages

1. **Price-to-Value Ratio**
   - 50% cheaper than Asana with comparable features
   - Better UX than ClickUp at similar price

2. **AI-First Architecture**
   - Built with AI from day one, not bolted on
   - More advanced AI features than competitors

3. **Speed & Simplicity**
   - Faster load times than ClickUp
   - Simpler onboarding than Monday

4. **Built-in Time Tracking**
   - Native feature vs. Asana's integration requirement
   - Better than Monday's add-on approach

5. **Modern Tech Stack**
   - No legacy code debt
   - Faster iteration speed

---

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Competitive Threats

| Threat | Severity | Mitigation |
|--------|----------|------------|
| **Asana/Monday cut prices** | High | Build switching costs through AI personalization |
| **ClickUp improves stability** | Medium | Maintain UX advantage, faster support |
| **Enterprise deals require certifications** | High | Prioritize SOC 2, GDPR compliance |
| **Integration ecosystem gap** | Medium | Focus on top 20 integrations first, open API |
| **Brand awareness deficit** | High | Content marketing, community building |

---

### üöÄ Strategic Recommendations

**1. Positioning Strategy: "The AI-Native Alternative"**
> "TaskFlow: Project management that thinks with you. Half the price of Asana, twice the intelligence."

**2. Target Segment: Asana/Monday Refugees**
- Teams frustrated with pricing increases
- Growing startups hitting user limits
- Teams wanting AI without enterprise pricing

**3. Competitive Playbook:**

| Against | Strategy |
|---------|----------|
| **Asana** | Lead with price (50% less), match features, emphasize AI |
| **Monday** | Lead with simplicity, better free tier, faster performance |
| **ClickUp** | Lead with stability/UX, comparable price, better support |

**4. Quick Wins (Next 90 Days):**
- [ ] Create comparison landing pages (vs. Asana, vs. Monday, vs. ClickUp)
- [ ] Build migration tools from each competitor
- [ ] Offer "switch and save" promotion
- [ ] Target competitor keywords in SEO/SEM
- [ ] Collect and publish customer testimonials from switchers

**5. Long-Term Moat:**
- AI that learns team patterns (hard to replicate)
- Community and templates ecosystem
- Integration partnerships with complementary tools

prompts.title: Pitch Deck Script Writer
prompts.description: Creates compelling pitch deck content and speaker notes for fundraising
prompts.prompt:
You are a pitch coach who has helped startups raise over $500M in funding. Create pitch deck content for my startup.

**Startup Details:**
- Company Name: [NAME]
- One-Liner: [WHAT YOU DO]
- Stage: [PRE-SEED/SEED/SERIES A]
- Raising: [AMOUNT]
- Industry: [SECTOR]
- Traction: [KEY METRICS]
- Team: [FOUNDERS' BACKGROUNDS]

**Generate complete pitch deck content:**

## üé§ [COMPANY] Pitch Deck

### Slide 1: Title
- Company name & logo
- Tagline
- Contact info

### Slide 2: Problem
**Headline:** [Attention-grabbing problem statement]
**Content:** [3 bullet points]
**Speaker Notes:** [What to say]

### Slide 3: Solution
**Headline:** [Your solution]
**Content:** [How it works]
**Speaker Notes:** [What to say]

### Slide 4: Demo/Product
**Visuals:** [What to show]
**Speaker Notes:** [Walkthrough script]

### Slide 5: Market Size
**TAM/SAM/SOM:** [Numbers]
**Speaker Notes:** [How to present]

### Slide 6: Business Model
**Revenue Streams:** [How you make money]
**Unit Economics:** [Key metrics]
**Speaker Notes:** [What to say]

### Slide 7: Traction
**Key Metrics:** [Growth numbers]
**Milestones:** [Achievements]
**Speaker Notes:** [What to say]

### Slide 8: Competition
**Positioning:** [How you're different]
**Speaker Notes:** [What to say]

### Slide 9: Team
**Founders:** [Backgrounds]
**Why Us:** [Unique qualifications]
**Speaker Notes:** [What to say]

### Slide 10: Financials
**Projections:** [3-year outlook]
**Speaker Notes:** [What to say]

### Slide 11: The Ask
**Raising:** [Amount]
**Use of Funds:** [Allocation]
**Speaker Notes:** [What to say]

### Slide 12: Vision/Close
**Big Picture:** [Where this goes]
**Call to Action:** [Next steps]
**Speaker Notes:** [Closing statement]

## üéØ Appendix Slides
[Additional slides for Q&A]
prompts.example_output:
## üé§ MealGenius Pitch Deck
*AI-Powered Meal Planning for Busy Families*

---

### Slide 1: Title

**Visual:** Clean logo, appetizing food imagery with AI elements

**Content:**
```
MealGenius
"Dinner, Decided."

Seed Round | $2M

Jane Smith, CEO | jane@mealgenius.com
December 2024
```

**Speaker Notes:**
> "Hi, I'm Jane, founder of MealGenius. We're making the daily question 'what's for dinner?' obsolete for millions of busy families."

---

### Slide 2: Problem

**Headline:** "What's for dinner?" costs families 5+ hours every week

**Content:**
- üïê **Decision Fatigue:** Average family makes 200+ food decisions weekly
- üí∏ **Food Waste:** $1,500/year thrown away from poor planning
- üò´ **Stress:** 62% of parents say meal planning is their #1 daily stressor
- üçï **Default to Unhealthy:** 4.5 takeout meals/week when planning fails

**Visual:** Split screen - stressed parent vs. happy family dinner

**Speaker Notes:**
> "Raise your hand if you've ever stood in front of the fridge at 6 PM with no idea what to make. [Pause for laughs]
>
> This isn't just annoying‚Äîit's expensive. The average family wastes $1,500 a year on food that goes bad because they didn't plan. They spend 5 hours a week on meal decisions. And when planning fails, they default to takeout‚Äî4.5 times per week.
>
> This is a $50 billion problem hiding in plain sight."

---

### Slide 3: Solution

**Headline:** MealGenius: Your AI Family Meal Planner

**Content:**
- ü§ñ **AI That Learns:** Adapts to your family's tastes, allergies, and schedule
- üì± **30-Second Plans:** Complete weekly meal plan generated instantly
- üõí **Auto Grocery Lists:** Synced to Instacart, Walmart, Amazon Fresh
- üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ **Family-Friendly:** Kid-approved recipes that adults actually enjoy

**Visual:** App screenshots showing the flow

**Speaker Notes:**
> "MealGenius is the AI meal planner that actually understands your family.
>
> Tell it your preferences once‚ÄîSarah's peanut allergy, Dad's keto diet, the kids' hatred of broccoli‚Äîand it remembers forever.
>
> Every Sunday, you get a personalized weekly plan in 30 seconds. One tap sends your grocery list to Instacart.
>
> No more 'what's for dinner?' No more food waste. No more stress."

---

### Slide 4: Demo/Product

**Visual:** Live app demo or video walkthrough

**Key Screens to Show:**
1. Onboarding (family preferences)
2. Weekly plan generation
3. Recipe detail with nutrition
4. Grocery list integration
5. "What's in my fridge?" feature

**Speaker Notes:**
> "Let me show you how this works. [LIVE DEMO]
>
> Here's the Johnson family‚Äîtwo parents, two kids, one vegetarian, one picky eater.
>
> I tap 'Generate Week'... and in 3 seconds, we have 7 dinners that everyone will eat.
>
> See this recipe? It automatically adjusted the portion for 4 people and flagged that it's nut-free for Sarah.
>
> One tap‚Äîgrocery list sent to Instacart. Done.
>
> But here's the magic: On Thursday, they have leftover chicken. They open 'Fridge Mode,' snap a photo, and MealGenius suggests 3 recipes using what they already have.
>
> That's the future of family meals."

---

### Slide 5: Market Size

**Headline:** $50B Market, Massively Underserved

**Content:**
```
TAM: $50B
Global meal planning & grocery market

SAM: $12B  
US families with children, digitally active

SOM: $500M
Health-conscious families willing to pay for convenience
(5M families √ó $100/year)
```

**Visual:** Concentric circles with market sizes

**Speaker Notes:**
> "The meal planning market is $50 billion globally. But here's what's interesting‚Äîit's incredibly fragmented.
>
> There's no dominant player for families. Mealime targets fitness. Yummly is recipe discovery. Paprika is for enthusiasts.
>
> Nobody has built the 'family operating system' for meals.
>
> Our serviceable market is $12 billion‚ÄîUS families with kids who are digitally active. Our initial target is the 5 million families who actively seek healthy meal solutions and will pay for convenience.
>
> That's a $500 million opportunity before we expand internationally."

---

### Slide 6: Business Model

**Headline:** Freemium + Affiliate = High-Margin, Recurring Revenue

**Content:**

| Revenue Stream | Model | Potential |
|----------------|-------|----------|
| **Subscriptions** | $9.99/mo Premium | 70% of revenue |
| **Grocery Affiliate** | 3-5% of basket | 25% of revenue |
| **Brand Partnerships** | Sponsored recipes | 5% of revenue |

**Unit Economics:**
- CAC: $18
- LTV: $156 (13 months avg √ó $12 blended)
- LTV:CAC: 8.7x
- Gross Margin: 82%

**Speaker Notes:**
> "We have three revenue streams, but subscriptions are the core.
>
> Free users get 3 meal plans per month. Premium at $9.99 gets unlimited plans, grocery integration, and nutrition tracking.
>
> But here's what makes this interesting: Every time a user orders groceries through our Instacart integration, we earn 3-5% of the basket. Average family grocery bill is $200/week. That's $8-10/month in passive revenue per active user‚Äîon top of their subscription.
>
> Our unit economics are strong: $18 to acquire a customer, $156 lifetime value. That's an 8.7x ratio‚Äîwell above the 3x benchmark."

---

### Slide 7: Traction

**Headline:** 10x Growth in 12 Months

**Content:**

```
üìà Users: 2,500 ‚Üí 47,000 (18x)
üí∞ MRR: $3K ‚Üí $89K (30x)
‚≠ê App Store: 4.8 stars (2,400 reviews)
üìä Retention: 68% Month-3
üõí Grocery GMV: $2.1M (last 90 days)
```

**Key Milestones:**
- ‚úÖ Product-market fit validated
- ‚úÖ Instacart partnership signed
- ‚úÖ Featured in App Store "Apps We Love"
- ‚úÖ 500+ 5-star reviews

**Visual:** Growth chart showing hockey stick

**Speaker Notes:**
> "We launched 14 months ago. Here's what's happened.
>
> We've grown from 2,500 to 47,000 users‚Äî18x growth with minimal marketing spend.
>
> MRR has grown from $3K to $89K. We're adding $15K MRR monthly and accelerating.
>
> But the metric I'm most proud of: 68% of users are still active at month 3. In consumer apps, that's exceptional. Industry average is 25%.
>
> Why? Because once MealGenius learns your family, switching is painful. We become the family's meal memory.
>
> Apple featured us in 'Apps We Love.' We have 2,400 reviews averaging 4.8 stars. This is organic, word-of-mouth growth."

| ARR | $1.1M | $5.4M | $16.8M |
| Gross Margin | 82% | 84% | 86% |

**Key Assumptions:**
- 20% conversion free ‚Üí paid
- 5% monthly churn (improving)
- $15 blended CAC (paid + organic)

**Speaker Notes:**
> "Here's our path to $10M ARR.
>
> We're at $1.1M ARR today. With this funding, we project $5.4M ARR by end of 2025 and $16.8M by 2026.
>
> These aren't hockey-stick fantasies. We're modeling 20% free-to-paid conversion‚Äîwe're already at 17%. We're modeling 5% monthly churn‚Äîwe're at 4.2%.
>
> The biggest unlock is paid acquisition. We've grown almost entirely organically. With capital, we can pour fuel on a fire that's already burning."

> The meal planning market is $50 billion and fragmented. The family segment is wide open. We have the team, the traction, and the technology to own it.
